abstract.t: DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) defines a domain-levelauthentication framework for email using public-key cryptography andkey server technology to permit verification of the source andcontents of messages by either Mail Transport Agents (MTAs) or MailUser Agents (MUAs). The primary DKIM protocol is described in[RFC4871]. This document describes the records that authors can useto advertise their practices for signing their outgoing mail, and howother hosts can access those records.
